poem:
"Of Kings and Silent Screens"

Oh Charlie boy, you rule the roost,
On the telly, not so aloof.
With worldly woes wrapped in your voice,
The attentive millions, they rejoice.

Mirror to misery, grief and strife,
Through box of light into our life.
Yet amid the cheer and festive clatter,
It's clear as day, words hardly matter.
